Protocol Editor

Default channel file

The channel file describes the sensors used for the acquisition: position, orientation, name, types, etc. It can be shared between different subjects of conditions, if the definition of the sensors is exactly the same for all the subjects, or for all the conditions within a given subject.

You will have to compute a head model and an inverse solution for each channel file, so if you share the channel file between several subjects or conditons, you can decrease significantly the time of computation and the amount of hard drive space required.

The possible options are:
  • No, use one channel file per condition (MEG).
Do not share the channel files. This means that you will have a independent head position for each condition of each subject.
Use this option for :
- MEG recordings (or simultaneous MEG and EEG), if there are more than one run per subject.
  • Yes, use one channel file per subject (MEG,EEG)
Share the channel file between all the conditions of a subject. You need to define a head position for each subject.
Use this option for:
- MEG recordings (or simultaneous MEG and EEG), if there are only one run per subject (or if there are several runs but that were realigned on the same head position).
- EEG recodings, only if you have digitized the positions of the electrodes for each subject.
  • Yes, use only one global channel file (EEG)
Share the same channel file for all the subjects and all the conditions.
Use this option for:
- EEG recordings, if you are going to use the same electrodes positions for all the subjects
